clusterList.phrase: we now know that the immune system of patients recovering from chemotherapy is malleable so we just need to find the best immunologic approach to exploit this window of opportunity
the good news was the surprisingly nice t cell response patients had to the flu vaccination even relatively soon after completing chemotherapy
that shows that the general idea of using immunotherapy following chemotherapy to prevent recurrence is not a flawed one chemotherapy depleted the immune system but we could restore it
this would open up the possibility of producing a large supply of immune-matched cells to that patient that could be used in transplantation methodologies
for every person put on treatment more get infected we cannot sustain a successful response if we do not get on top of prevention
